title: SDE 2 - Backend (Video Engineering)
description:
FanCode is India‚Äôs premier digital sports destination, dedicated to delivering a best\\-in\\-class experience for fans across live and non\\-live sports. Launched in March 2019 by industry veterans Yannick Colaco and Prasana Krishnan, FanCode has reached over 160 million users. The platform features a wide array of global and domestic sporting leagues, in partnership with leading sports associations. FanCode offers interactive live streaming through industry\\-first subscription models, including Match, Bundle, and Tour Passes, as well as monthly and annual plans at accessible price points. Some of the marquee properties include La Liga, Formula 1, MotoGP, cricket leagues from around the globe including CPL, Super Smash amongst others.
 



  





 Dream Sports, India‚Äôs leading Sports Technology company, is the parent company of FanCode, with brands such as Dream11, and DreamSetGo in its portfolio.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are building a next\\-generation, high\\-performance video platform that powers live sports streaming at massive scale. As a Backend Engineer in the Video Engineering team, you will design and build distributed systems that handle real\\-time ingest, encoding, packaging, storage, and delivery of live video to millions of fans.
 



 You will work across AWS Media Services and Cloud, GCP cloud, and internal video platform components including our custom video stack. This role is ideal for engineers who enjoy solving deep technical challenges in video systems, distributed backend architectures, and real\\-time data flows.
 



  





**What you'll do:** 



* Collaborate with Video Operations, Player, and Platform teams to ensure reliability, observability, and world\\-class streaming quality.
* Being part of a lean backend team which has streamed over 50,000 hours of live content.
* Building high performance and scalable software platforms for a global product
* Developing and owning product components ‚Äì from inception to production to scaling up, supporting new requirements, re\\-architectures
* Work with leaders in Product and Engineering to drive and implement platform and product vision
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to improve development efficiency



  





**Must haves:** 



* 4‚Äì7 years of backend engineering experience using Java, Go, Node.js, or equivalent.
* Strong understanding of distributed systems, concurrency, memory\\-efficient programming, and performance optimization.
* Experience building REST APIs, microservices, and containerized services (Docker/Kubernetes).
* Strong SQL and NoSQL database knowledge.
* Solid debugging skills in cloud\\-native environments (logs, metrics, tracing).



  





**Good to have:** 



* Experience with AWS Media Services (MediaConnect, MediaLive, MediaConvert, CloudFront).
* Experience with live video encoders or other broadcast encoding systems.
* Knowledge of SRT, RTMP, WebRTC ingest pipelines.
* Experience building high\\-throughput real\\-time systems (video, gaming, trading, messaging, etc.).
* Familiarity with packaging workflows, manifest editing, and SSAI\\-related concepts.
* Exposure to QoE and perceptual quality metrics: VMAF, PSNR, SSIM, NR\\-VQA.
* Interest in sports broadcasting, low\\-latency workflows, or automation tooling.
* Passion for sports is a bonus.

**Role Overview** 




 As a Web Developer Intern at WEBS IT SOLUTION, you will work on designing, developing, and maintaining dynamic websites and web applications. This internship is ideal for students or graduates passionate about coding, UI/UX design, and building responsive, scalable web solutions from concept to deployment.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Company Description
 



 Harmony.AI is an AI\\-driven platform that revolutionizes the hiring process by focusing on skills and digital portfolios instead of traditional resumes. The platform enables talent to display their actual competencies and helps employers make smarter, data\\-driven hiring decisions. With advanced match scores and insights, Harmony.AI offers a faster and fairer way to connect talent with opportunities. We aim to enhance transparency and efficiency in career development and recruitment processes.
 



  





 Job Title: Custom Software Engineer ‚Äì ServiceNow ITSM
 



 Experience: 5 to 8 Years
 



  





**Apply: https://app.harmony\\-ai.in/jobs** 




  





 Role Summary
 



  





 As a Custom Software Engineer ‚Äì ServiceNow ITSM at Applore Technologies, you will be responsible for designing, developing, configuring, and optimizing ServiceNow applications to meet business process and application requirements.
 



  





 You will work closely with cross\\-functional teams to understand requirements, translate them into scalable ServiceNow solutions, and ensure alignment with organizational IT service management goals. The role requires hands\\-on expertise, independent ownership of modules, and a strong problem\\-solving mindset.
 



  





 Roles \\& Responsibilities
 



 Design, build, configure, and customize ServiceNow ITSM applications based on business requirements
 



 Work independently and gradually evolve into a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for assigned modules
 



 Collaborate with stakeholders, developers, and functional teams during requirement discussions
 



 Actively contribute to solution design and provide inputs to resolve work\\-related technical challenges
 



 Perform development, configuration, and customization using ServiceNow best practices
 



 Participate in and support code reviews to ensure quality, performance, and maintainability
 



 Assist in preparing and maintaining technical documentation, including workflows, configurations, and integrations
 



 Perform testing, debugging, and troubleshooting to ensure application stability and optimal performance
 



 Continuously identify opportunities for improvement, optimization, and automation within ServiceNow implementations
 



  





 Professional \\& Technical Skills
 



 Must\\-Have Skills
 



  





 Strong proficiency in ServiceNow IT Service Management (ITSM)
 



 In\\-depth understanding of ITSM processes and frameworks (Incident, Problem, Change, Request, CMDB, etc.)
 



 Hands\\-on experience with ServiceNow application development and configuration
 



 Good working knowledge of ServiceNow scripting (JavaScript, Business Rules, Client Scripts, UI Policies, Script Includes)
 



 Proven ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex application and configuration issues

With a passionate team of more than 100 changemakers and a community of 10,000\\+ peers, PANHA provides empathetic support services, including anonymous chat, one\\-on\\-one peer listening, an AI\\-driven support model, and professional counseling therapy sessions. Committed to addressing issues like breakup trauma, family disputes, academic pressure, financial stress, anxiety, and more, PANHA strives to create a judgment\\-free space for healing and connection.  This is a volunteer remote role for a Full Stack Developer. The individual in this role will collaborate with the team to design, develop, and maintain both front\\-end and back\\-end applications for the PANHA platform. title: Axway API Gateway
description:

 Kindly find below JD

 We are seeking a highly motivated API Gateway Developer to join our integration and middleware team. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining API solutions using Axway API Gateway and Axway API Manager. The ideal candidate should have hands\\-on experience in API development, integration patterns, and securing enterprise APIs.

title: GPU Development Engineer
description:
**Who We Are**
 Applied Materials is a global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. We design, build and service cutting\\-edge equipment that helps our customers manufacture display and semiconductor chips ‚Äì the brains of devices we use every day. As the foundation of the global electronics industry, Applied enables the exciting technologies that literally connect our world ‚Äì like AI and IoT. If you want to push the boundaries of materials science and engineering to create next generation technology, join us to deliver material innovation that changes the world.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Location:
   

  

 Bangalore,IND, Pune,IND
   

  

 You‚Äôll benefit from a supportive work culture that encourages you to learn, develop, and grow your career as you take on challenges and drive innovative solutions for our customers. We empower our team to push the boundaries of what is possible‚Äîwhile learning every day in a supportive leading global company. Visit our Careers website to learn more.
   

  

 At Applied Materials, we care about the health and wellbeing of our employees. We‚Äôre committed to providing programs and support that encourage personal and professional growth and care for you at work, at home, or wherever you may go. Learn more about our benefits.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer at Applied Materials, you‚Äôll dive deep into ground\\-breaking technologies‚Äîlike machine learning and AI‚Äîto craft novel software solutions that solve our customers‚Äô high\\-value problems. Our Software Engineers are responsible for designing, prototyping, developing, and debugging software solutions for semiconductor equipment components and devices to ensure quality and functionality. You'll develop software documentation and test procedures, troubleshoot software problems, and communicate with internal customers to understand project requirements. As part of our team, you'll contribute your expertise in intricate systems, deciphering code, and anticipating software behaviors to ensure Applied remains the leader in the semiconductor and display sectors.
   

  

 We are seeking an expert GPU programmer to work on our multi\\-physics computational modeling codes. Your primary responsibility will be to extend the existing parallel processing capabilities in these codes for massive CPU\\-GPU parallelization. Your initial areas of focus will be models for radiation and ray\\-tracing, particle\\-tracking, chemical kinetics, fluid dynamics, turbulence, heat\\-transfer, plasma physics, solid mechanics, and their supporting infrastructures, especially iterative linear solvers.
   

  

**Essential Functions / Job Description**
 Develop CPU\\-GPU parallelization architectures for different multi\\-physics modules based on a deep understanding of the underlying solution algorithms, data flows, and memory usage of each module.
   

  

 Implement the parallel processing architectures designed for specific modules, and ensure high parallel efficiency through profiling, optimization, and tuning on the full suite of representative application cases.
   

  

 Re\\-design, refactor, and re\\-write existing Fortran 90 and C/C\\+\\+ computational physics modules to prepare them for GPU and hybrid parallelization.
   

  

 The development work will require involvement in all phases of the development lifecycle, including technical requirements definition, planning, software design, software implementation, testing, support, quality assurance, extension, maintenance, and documentation.
   

  

 Guide and participate in developing long\\-term roadmaps for hybrid parallelization using MPI, CUDA/OpenCL, and OpenMP of computational modeling codes at Applied Materials.
   

  

**Education And Skills / Job Requirements**
 An M.Sc, M.Tech, or PhD degree in computer science, applied mathematics, physics, or a computational modeling discipline, with emphasis on GPU parallelization and programming.
   

  

 Demonstrable talent and skill in software design, development, and testing. A high level of skill in profiling, debugging, and tuning GPU programs.
   

  

 A high level of proficiency in C/C\\+\\+, Python, CUDA, and OpenCL, and a readiness to learn other languages, such as Fortran 90\\.
   

  

 A high level of proficiency in MPI and OpenMP.
   

  

 Originality, creativity, and excellent problem\\-solving skills.
   

  

 Desire to learn about different computational physics modeling methods and technologies.
   

  

 Ability to work independently as well as in close collaboration with other computational scientists.
   

  

 The successful candidate will be a member of the Computational Products and Solutions Center of Excellence at Applied Materials. You will work with other talented and capable peers developing various modules of our flagship multi\\-physics software. The work environment is stimulating, collaborative, and rewarding, with good opportunities for learning, growth, and diversification of expertise and knowledge. You will work on difficult but solvable problems, and your work will have a far\\-reaching impact at Applied Materials, and hence on all of humanity. This position is ideal for someone with a passion for scientific computing, high\\-performance computing, and taking parallel processing techniques to their limits.
   

  

 Location
   

  

 The position is open in Applied Materials offices in Bengaluru or Pune.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Employee Type:**
 Assignee / Regular
   

  

**Travel:**
 Yes, 10% of the Time
   

  

**Relocation Eligible:**
 Yes
   

  

 Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Senior Integration Engineer
description:
Design, build, and operate secure, reliable integrations and automated workloads that connect internal and external systems across the enterprise. This role ensures consistent data flow, API/service quality, and predictable batch processing operations that meet business SLAs. The engineer will work across modern integration platforms (iPaaS, API gateways, messaging systems) while leveraging workload automation tools for orchestration. Experience with MuleSoft is preferred but not required.
   

  

**Key Accountabilities**
**Integration Engineering (Any Integration Platform; MuleSoft Preferred):**
* Design, implement, and support APIs, integrations, and data flows using modern integration platforms (e.g., API gateways, ESBs, iPaaS).
* Apply established integration patterns (REST, SOAP, event‚Äëdriven, pub/sub, file‚Äëbased, batch) and enterprise design standards.
* Develop and maintain API specifications and integration documentation.
* Implement error handling, logging, observability, and integration‚Äëlevel SLAs.
* Stay current with integration platform capabilities and best practices.
* Preferred: Experience with MuleSoft (Anypoint Platform, API‚ÄëLed design, connectors, policies).


**Workload Automation (Control‚ÄëM Or Equivalent)**
* Configure, administer, and optimize enterprise workload automation tools (e.g., Control‚ÄëM, Airflow, Autosys, UC4\\).
* Build and maintain job flows, dependencies, calendars, and automated schedules.
* Migrate existing job chains from legacy or on‚Äëprem systems into modern scheduling platforms.
* Implement alerting, SLA management, runbooks, and job recovery strategies.
* Support operational readiness, including incident response and root‚Äëcause analysis.


**Shared Engineering Responsibilities**
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines, deployment automation, and development workflows.
* Participate in peer reviews (code, job flows, API designs) to ensure quality standards are met.
* Create and maintain validation evidence, change records, and documentation required for regulated/validated environments.
* Collaborate with architecture, product teams, vendors, and operations to deliver secure, scalable solutions.
* Participate in on‚Äëcall rotation for integration and workload automation services.


**Skills**
* Strong understanding of modern integration concepts (API‚Äëled connectivity, eventing, asynchronous processing, API gateways, ESB/iPaaS solutions).
* Hands‚Äëon experience with at least one enterprise integration platform; MuleSoft preferred.
* Hands‚Äëon experience with one or more enterprise scheduling/orchestration tools (Control‚ÄëM strongly preferred).
* Proficiency with scripting or development languages (e.g., Java, Python, JavaScript).
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools (GitLab, Azure DevOps, Jenkins) and automated testing practices.
* Effective communication, collaboration, and vendor‚Äëengagement skills.


**Knowledge \\& Experience**
* 5‚Äì7\\+ years of integration engineering experience using enterprise integration technologies.
* Experience designing and operating APIs and integrations at scale.
* Experience supporting or administering job scheduling/workload automation solutions.
* Experience working in Agile environments and delivering high‚Äëquality, secure, and reliable services.
* Experience in regulated/validated environments (GxP, SDLC/Change Control) is a plus.
* Preferred: MuleSoft certifications or hands‚Äëon MuleSoft development/administration.


**Education Qualification**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Systems, or related field.

* Experience in building interfaces using Mule Batch processing, Exception handling and Logging frameworks.
* Experience with the following technologies is a plus (Anypoint FlexGateway, Anypoint Experience Hub).
* Ability to work collaboratively on a geographically distributed team.
* Comfortable engaging with vendors and other engineering teams on a highly technical level.
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills, and presentation skills.
* Goal oriented and self\\-motivated within a collaborative team environment.
* Ability to iterate quickly in an agile environment.
* Ability to learn new technologies and skills quickly.
company_industry: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care

title: Senior digital science associate
description:
**Job Description:**
**About Fuels \\& Low Carbon Technology:** 
 F\\&LCT is a team of over 300 technologists, scientists and engineers who provide pioneering solutions to support bp's Fuels, Refining, Bioenergy and Hydrogen businesses. We also support the Technology group through Innovation Management, Modelling, Digital Science and our academic research programmes.
   

  

**Let me tell you about the role:**
 The Digital Science team applies groundbreaking digital innovation capabilities to bp's challenge of providing energy to the world while transitioning to a zero\\-carbon future. This team is the Digital Research arm for bp, responsible for testing of emerging technologies to tackle key challenges in support of our business. Digital Science is crucial to the success of bp and the transition strategy.
   

  

 You will carry out innovation projects, translating Digital Science activities into value, interfacing with other teams in Technology, with the business directly, and occasionally with bp's corporate venture capital organization.
   

  

**What you will deliver:**
* Lead the delivery of your projects to production, scan the horizon to identify emerging Digital Technology trends, new products and solutions potentially relevant to solve key challenges from roadmaps; and assessing potential vendors. Proactively identify impactful opportunities and autonomously complete activities.
* Be a bridge between business and digital organizations, combining in\\-depth understanding of both areas.
* Develop others by mentoring Digital Science Associates, and proactively sharing expertise and interests with others.
* Develop and nurture external relationships for long term collaboration
* Demonstrate recognizing value/benefit of technology in adjacent business areas.
* Lead the identification of digital technologies that can address specific business challenges. Active research work to prove (or disprove) viability or potential value of a technology to bp (i.e. solving a key business problem).
* Summarize the learning gained from implementing projects, and communicate to others in the team.
* Support identification opportunities for new intellectual property, and engage in the processes needed to protect these for the benefit of the company. Apply IAM \\& Commercial rigour to projects.
* Develop as an expert in two or more technology areas including Quantum, trust tech and sensing. Acts as a knowledge transfer agent to the wider community in bp with demonstrable thought leadership pieces of work: Papers/etc.
* Collaborate with government labs, academic institutions and research firms, consortia for joint projects.


**What You Will Need To Be Successful**
* A degree in science, Technology, Engineering or Math (or equivalent), preferably with a background in Computer Science/Engineering, PhD desired.
* Experience which demonstrates how you have applied your knowledge of emerging technology in a practical context; this could be in a development role or guiding the way technology is built (e.g. a software company) or helping with adoption (e.g. an enterprise digital role).
* Experience in a digital space, ideally energy sector, developing applications of novel digital technologies \\- research, scanning and testing of new technologies. Demonstrable work product in terms of papers, test results, etc.
* Be a self\\-starter who is comfortable defining an approach to deliver project goals and changing the approach as new information becomes available.
* Understanding of the bp strategy, and the role that disruptive digital innovation can play in a corporate environment as an enabler and to define the future.
* Sound understanding of emerging digital technology ecosystems. Curiosity and an ability to creatively link diverse topics. Growing technological expertise in innovative digital areas such as computing/quantum, sensing, trust tech.
* Ability to provide leadership on specific elements of a project and lead a sub team(s).
* Ability to manage contracting and intellectual asset management issues which impact individual projects.
* Understanding of management risk associated with new technologies
* Ability to build productive working relationships and foster creativity, innovation and integrity within teams
* Provide technical clarity and business direction to senior management and be able to flex communication style to best suit the audience.
* Self starter, ability to work in unstructured environments, proven capability to produce outputs in a timely manner by collaborating with different customers across multiple groups.


 We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**About bp:** 
 Our purpose is to deliver energy to the world, today and tomorrow. For over 100 years, bp has focused on discovering, developing, and producing oil and gas in the nations where we operate. We are one of the few companies globally that can provide governments and customers with an integrated energy offering. Delivering our strategy sustainably is fundamental to achieving our ambition to be a net zero company by 2050 or sooner!
   

  

**Travel Requirement**
 Up to 10% travel should be expected with this role
   

  

**Relocation Assistance:**
 This role is eligible for relocation within country
   

  

**Remote Type:**
 This position is a hybrid of office/remote working
   

  

**Skills:**
 Commercial Acumen, Communication, Data Analysis, Data cleansing and transformation, Data domain knowledge, Data Integration, Data Management, Data Manipulation, Data Sourcing, Data strategy and governance, Data Structures and Algorithms (Inactive), Data visualization and interpretation, Digital Security, Extract, transform and load, Group Problem Solving
   

  

**Legal Disclaimer:**
 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with an accessibility need may request an adjustment/accommodation related to bp's recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an adjustment/accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us.
   

  

 If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. This may include pre\\-placement drug screening, medical review of physical fitness for the role, and background checks.

title: Principal Electrical Engineer
description:
Job Title: Principal Electrical Engineer
   

  

 Company: Tecnimont
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Principal Electrical Engineer at Tecnimont, you will be responsible for leading electrical engineering projects from conception through completion while ensuring adherence to industry standards, quality, and safety. You will manage a team of engineers and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to design, develop, and implement electrical systems and solutions for various engineering projects. Your expertise will guide project planning, execution, and troubleshooting, ensuring timely and cost\\-effective delivery.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the design and implementation of electrical systems for industrial projects.
* Conduct feasibility studies and create technical specifications for electrical components and systems.
* Oversee the development of project plans, schedules, and budgets.
* Ensure compliance with relevant electrical codes and standards.
* Manage a team of electrical engineers, providing mentorship, guidance, and fostering professional development.
* Collaborate with project managers, clients, and stakeholders to define project requirements and deliverables.
* Perform risk assessments and implement mitigation strategies related to electrical systems.
* Review and approve engineering designs, documentation, and project deliverables.
* Monitor project progress and provide regular updates to senior management.
* Participate in site inspections and provide technical support during construction phases.


**Skills And Tools Required**
* Proven experience in electrical engineering design and project management.
* Strong understanding of electrical systems, components, and industry standards.
* Proficiency in electrical design software such as AutoCAD, ETAP, or similar tools.
* Excellent analytical and problem\\-solving skills.
* Strong leadership and team management abilities.
* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Familiarity with safety regulations and best practices in engineering.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.
* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field; a Master's degree or Professional Engineer (PE) certification is preferred.
* Experience in industrial sectors (oil and gas, energy, etc.) is an advantage.


 If you are a dynamic electrical engineer looking to contribute to innovative projects and work with a talented team at Tecnimont, we encourage you to apply.
